snippet: The mortality rate in Massachusetts dropped sharply after the state overhauled health care in 2006, a study has found, offering evidence that universal coverage has saved lives, health economists say.
abstract: Study published online in the Annals of Internal Medicine finds that the mortality rate in Massachusetts dropped sharply after the state overhauled health care in 2006, offering what health economists say is evidence that universal coverage has saved lives.
lead_paragraph: The mortality rate in Massachusetts dropped sharply after the state overhauled health care in 2006, a study has found, offering evidence that universal coverage has saved lives, health economists say.

headline.main: Mortality Drop Seen to Follow ’06 Health Law
headline.print_headline: Mortality Drop Follows Massachusetts Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
